citeinfo.title: Late Cenozoic Sea-Level History in Western Alaska

abstract.p:
Data reflecting high sea level in western Alaska, ranging in age from late Pliocene to recent. At least seven intervals of high sea level are recorded in western Alaska by deposits ranging in age from late Pliocene to recent: 1) Krusensternian transgression
2) Woronzofian transgression
3) Pelukian transgression
4) Kotzebuan transgression
5) Einahnuhtan transgression
6) Anvillian transgression
7) Beringian transgression

[Reference: Hopkins, D.M., 1967, Late Cenozoic sea-level history in western Alaska [abs.]: Pacific Science Congress, 11 th , Tokyo, 1966, Symposium 19, Journal of Geosciences, Osaka City University, v. 10, no. 19, p. 67.]

descript.purpose: To provide high sea levels of western Alaska.
